quiz.question: The Council of the Federation can approve or reject laws issued by the State Duma.
Dmitry Medvedev was the first Russian President.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: Boris Yeltsin was the first Russian President.)

quiz.question: The leading political party in Russia is United Russia (Putin’s party) and it holds the majority of the seats in the State Duma.
There is only one house in the legislative branch and it is called the Council of the Federation.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: Russia has two houses—the State Duma and the Council of the Federation.)

quiz.question: Members of the State Duma are elected by popular vote for a period of 5 years.
The Supreme Court in Russia deals with every court case including the matters concerning the constitution.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: The Constitutional Court handles constitutional matters.)

quiz.question: Archipelago GULAG is a metaphor for a network of prison labor camps.
During Stalin's Great Purge millions were sent to GULAGS.
The Gulag camps were radically reduced after Stalin’s death but continued to exist until the Gorbachev era.
One of the main reasons for the start of Stalin's Great Purge was that his party members started questioning his authority.
The Treaty of Rapallo was signed between the Soviet Union and Germany.
The secret agreement of the Ribbentrop-Molotov pact was found after the capitulation of Germany.
There were about 26.6 million Soviet lives lost in WWII.
Russian politicians and the general population of Russia have a preference for autocracy.
The Brezhnev Doctrine allowed the Warsaw Pact troops to intervene in any Eastern Bloc nation if they attempted to change their course away from communist rule.
The official end of the Cold War was in 1988 when the USSR agreed to a major reduction of weapons and pledged not to interfere with Eastern Europe politics.
Yeltsin’s main goal when becoming president was to overcome the hostility of the Cold War to improve the economic situation in Russia.

Internal politics turned into foreign politics with the dissolution of the USSR because the USSR was composed of multiple republics that since 1991 had to create new types of policies with each other.
Putin in his early presidency wanted to continue Yeltsin’s democratic approach in order to keep peace with the West.
In regard to foreign policy, Khrushchev did not want to promote good relations with the West.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: Khrushchev initially sought better relations with the West.)

quiz.question: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization was created to provide collective security against the Soviet Union.
Russia did not inherit the veto power of the USSR in the UN Security Council.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: Russia did inherit the USSR’s veto power.)

quiz.question: The systemic opposition is the opposition that does NOT support Putin.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: The systemic opposition supports the current political structure.)

quiz.question: Putin’s administration created the Smart Voting App to rig elections through online voting.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: The Smart Voting App was created by opposition leader Alexei Navalny.)

quiz.question: Russia officially sent its military forces to annex the Crimea and announce it as Russian territory.
The annexation of Crimea was followed by a war between pro-Russian separatists and Ukrainian forces.
Non-systemic opposition is the true opposition.
Navalny is part of the systemic opposition.
quiz.answer: False (Correct answer: Navalny is part of the non-systemic opposition.)

options: Council of Federation can create laws
Russia is a federation and parliamentary republic
Council of Federation approve or reject laws

quiz.answer: Council of Federation approve or reject laws

quiz.question: What does the archipelago Gulag refer to?

The map of bases of the secret police
The span of multiple prison camps during the 20th century

quiz.question: Where were the largest Gulag camps generally located?
options: Close to the big administrative centers
In the most extreme climate regions
In the regions close to the borders with the West

quiz.answer: All of the above are correct

options: Promote the oppositional candidates that support him
Make money off the app to fund his anti-Putin activity

quiz.question: The concept of Putin's majority…
options: Is fake; he does not have the support of the majority of the population
Is real and he has indeed had the support of the majority of the population during his presidencies
quiz.answer: Is real and he has indeed had the support of the majority of the population during his presidencies

quiz.question: Why does current administration rig elections?
options: To stop the true opposition from getting seats in the parliament or running against Putin
To win against the systemic opposition to have the majority in the State Duma
To achieve a supermajority to promote the continued support of the population
quiz.answer: To stop the true opposition from getting seats in the parliament or running against Putin

quiz.question: Which is not true about the Treaty of Rapallo?
options: First official acknowledgement of the Soviet Union
Treaty between Soviet Union and the Allied forces
Renounced all territorial and financial claims against each other
quiz.answer: Treaty between Soviet Union and the Allied forces

quiz.question: What is the correct ordering of Russian leaders from oldest to newest throughout Russian history?

The iron fence around Putin’s palace to keep the journalists away
Modern Russia cutting off all contact from foreign countries
